Class RobotStatePanel

java.lang.Object

                          +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.RobotStatePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class RobotStatePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

The RobotStatePanel is a GUI component that shows the current status of the robot gripper, arm, and the object presence sensor. It might be easier to change the implementation of this class so that the images are loaded into JLabels instead of using the graphics API.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

RobotStatePanel

public RobotStatePanel(java.lang.String type)
Allocate a new RobotStatePanel that shows the status of the specified type. The possible values for type can be: T_ARM, T_GRIP or T_OBJ

Parameters:
type - the type of status
